Pretty  much one of the worst tops in the game, even though she's also probably one of the most fun and used to be one of the most rewarding when played right.

Her passive "buff" literally did nothing for her at all.      You don't have enough AD early to make that even worth glancing at with such a small change.

The only reason why she is doing terrible atm is because she lost 1 item. Which is The Brutalizer. That item gave her enough stats to destroy any top laner because of the sheer amount of stats she heavily benefits from. All she needs to do is farm for that item and kill at lv 6. Thats the safest route. the riskier route is to kill at lv 2/3.

Now you actually have to play smart and not faceroll as opposed to what other people say when she was FOTM.

Yeah, she's only at 47% winrate with a mediocre playrate. No need for buffs at all.

^ Okay

This right here is one of the major disappointments i have with the League community. We need to get it out of our heads that all champs NEED to have a 50% win rate to be balanced. That's simply not the case.

In a world where everyone is 50% win rate, why would i EVER pick a jungler that ISN'T Lee sin, or an AD that ISN'T Vayne? if you master these champs, you can get the absolute most of them and use their high potential for outplay and carrying ability to run over the whole game.

People need to accept that win rate is a representative of player success ON AVERAGE and is representative of how an AVERAGE player who has little mastery of a particular champ does in a given game. It is not an objective measure of champion "goodness."

Watch Box Box's stream and watch him tear assholes on Riven. He can do that because he has a very clear mastery of every detail on that champ. Is Riven annoying? Yeah she is, but the average player shouldn't be able to pick up Riven and immediately destroy everyone with her. Her complexity shouldn't allow her to do that. 

LIKEWISE Irelia is actually a relatively complex champion. People like Irelia Carries U and other people play Irelia at a very high level and take advantage of a lot of the nuances in her kit, specifically in her Q and W. If Irelia were to have a 51% win rate on average, she'd start drawing bans immediately. At a point where Irelia has a 51% win rate, any bum can take a semi-complex champion and has just above a coinflip's chance of winning. That's not representative of Irelia's somewhat steep mastery curve. 

As far as play rate, that's just player preference. People are going to pick shit that's strong, and they're going to pick champs that are fun. If she's not overly strong, people that aren't big fans aren't going to pick her. To use pickrate as a measure of her success is also pretty stupid.

TL;DR
Complex champs with steep mastery curves and high potential for outplay and good use shouldn't have a 50% win rate. Irelia IS one of those champions

Really? Because Irelia's winrate increase kinda tapers off after 20 or so games on her. She's not Azir or anything.

And yes, Irelia is kinda complex, but she's not complex enough to warrant a 47% winrate. She still has almost all targeted abilities and relatively simple use cases. Again, she's not Azir.
